page.title: 01THE VILLAGE SHOP
page.content: The village shop in{Little Dewchurch is like most such shops in this area. It has{room for about 10 customers}and is{rather crowded. }The goods are on {shelves}on the walls, and customers {ask the shopkeeper}for what they want instead of getting it themselves and paying on the way out. This shop has been in the{same family for 60 years. It is{not doing as well as it once did because it is{no longer a Post Office and the{expenses}are getting too high. Also, people now shop at{superstores in{Hereford}instead, where there is much{more choice}and the goods are {cheaper. }The shop has mainly{sweets, {cigarettes,}and some{groceries. Business is much the same all year round, except when it{snows}- then people get blocked in and can't get to Hereford, so they have to use the shop.
